name: Piercer
lore: A piercer is a creature that resembles a stalactite, clinging to the ceiling of a cavern and dropping onto creatures that pass below. Related to the roper, some sages believe piercers are a juvenile form of that larger predator. A piercer that survives long enough and consumes sufficient prey may eventually undergo a transformation into a roper.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.description: If the piercer is motionless at the start of combat, it has Advantage on its Initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the piercer move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the piercer is animate.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: The piercer can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Drop
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach 5 ft. Hit: 3 (1d6) Piercing damage per 10 feet fallen, up to 21 (6d6). Miss: The piercer takes half the damage it would have dealt.

attack.targets: one creature directly below the piercer

miss.effects: The piercer takes half the damage it would have dealt.
